This is a pretty annoying message.  I get at least 6 "Widget is Disposed" (and
another 6 "Unhandled...") exceptions logged when I close a dialog whose table
has not fully populated.

Could you give some example code or point to somewhere in the SDK where this
happens? I have tried replicating using the Concurrent Table View and I can't.

Created an attachment (id=26128)
Small test case

Here is a test case.  I am able to reproduce the problem about 90% of the time.
 Run as an SWT application.

Click the launch button.  In the new dialog, click the "Add 100000" button. 
Then immediately click OK or Cancel or Close.  Sometimes, you may need to wait
for the scroll bar to show up before closing the dialog.

Just FYI:  I've sped up my label provider (which is used for sorting and
filtering as well as for display) and that has helped considerably.  Now, I have
to try a bit harder to get the exceptions to show in my application.  And fewer
of them now show up when they do come.

Fixed in build >20050822. We now check if the control is disposed and use the
display from the control rather than caching the current one.

Thanks again for the test case - it was a lot of help.
